IRS990.MissionDesc: FOR OVER 100 YEARS, KENT PLACE'S MISSION IS TO OFFER STUDENTS OF DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS IN PRESCHOOL THROUGH GRADE 12 AN ACADEMICALLY RIGOROUS CURRICULUM IN A CARING ATMOSPHERE, TO INSPIRE YOUNG WOMEN TO LEADERSHIP AND TO STRENGTHEN MORAL AWARENESS. KENT PLACE PROVIDES THE STIMULUS FOR EACH STUDENT TO ACHIEVE HER FULL ACADEMIC, PHYSICAL AND CREATIVE POTENTIAL, TO LOVE LEARNING, TO GAIN CONFIDENCE, TO LIVE RESPONSIBLY AND TO DEVELOP RESPECT FOR HERSELF AND OTHERS IN THE GLOBAL COMMUNITY.
IRS990.Desc: OUR CURRICULUM AT KENT PLACE BEST EXPRESSES OUR COMMITMENT TO CHALLENGING GIRLS, INSPIRING THEIR LOVE OF LEARNING AND OFFERING THE RICHEST EDUCATION POSSIBLE. CLASSES ARE TAUGHT BY FACULTY WHO ARE MASTERS IN THEIR FIELDS AND PASSIONATE ABOUT LEARNING. VISUAL AND PERFORMING ARTS, AS WELL AS SPORTS INSTRUCTION, ARE AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS. IN A TYPICAL YEAR, MORE THAN 90 OF UPPER SCHOOL STUDENTS DEVOTE OVER 7,000 HOURS TO COMMUNITY SERVICE, AS WELL AS HAVE ENGAGED IN OUR GLOBAL SERVICE LEARNING INITIATIVE. KENT PLACE OFFERS SUMMER PROGRAMS WITH TRADITIONAL DAY CAMP, ENRICHMENT ACADEMIES, AND THE GIRLS LEADERSHIP INSTITUTE. KENT PLACE ALSO HAS AN ETHICS INSTITUTE, AFTERSCHOOL ENRICHMENT PROGRAMS, EXTENDED CARE, AND A GREEN CAMPUS INITIATIVE. OUR ETHICS INSTITUTE, A FIRST-OF-ITS-KIND AT THE ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY SCHOOL LEVELS, BELIEVES THAT FOSTERING ETHICAL THINKING AND ETHICAL DECISION-MAKING IN THE YOUNGEST OF CHILDREN PREPARES THEM TO BE THE MOST EFFECTIVE LEADERS AND COMPASSIONATE CITIZENS OF TOMORROW.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INVESTMENT INCOME - $ 648,803 REALIZED GAIN ON INVESTMENTS - $ 403,800 DIRECT FUNDRAISING EXPENSES - $(174,781) COST OF GOODS SOLD - $(105,243) ROUNDING - $ 1 TOTAL - $ 772,580
DIRECT FUNDRAISING EXPENSES - $174,781 COST OF GOODS SOLD - $105,243 ROUNDING - $1 TOTAL - $280,025

THE SCHOOL HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE (THE "IRS") AS AN ORGANIZATION DESCRIBED UNDER 501(c)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (THE "CODE") AS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(a) OF THE CODE. MANAGEMENT HAS ANALYZED THE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE SCHOOL AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT AS OF JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION OF A LIABILITY OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE SCHOOL RECOGNIZES ACCRUED INTEREST AND PENALTIES ASSOCIATED WITH UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS, IF ANY. THERE WERE NO INCOME TAX-RELATED INTEREST AND PENALTIES RECORDED FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017.
THE ENDOWMENT SUPPORTS STUDENT FINANCIAL AID AND OTHER EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES SUCH AS PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR FACULTY AND STAFF.
A STATEMENT OF POLICY IS PUBLISHED IN THE LEGAL ADVERTISEMENT SECTION OF LOCAL NEWSPAPERS.
FINANCIAL AID IS PROVIDED TO STUDENTS IN NEED IN ACCORDANCE WITH AN APPLICATION PROCESS.
NON-TAXABLE BENEFITS FOR INDIVIDUALS LISTED INCLUDE MEDICAL, DISBILITY AND PENSION BENEFITS PAID BY THE SCHOOL. NON-TAXABLE BENEFITS ALSO INCLUDE A HOUSING ALLOWANCE FOR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL.
THE SCHOOL UTILIZES AN OUTSIDE BROKER TO FACILITATE THE SALE OF DONATED STOCKS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, Line 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE. THE FORM IS MADE AVAILABLE TO BOARD MEMBERS FOR 7 DAYS PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, Line 12
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE HEAD OF SCHOOL MAINTAINS THE STATEMENTS OF CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. THE STATEMENTS ARE SIGNED ANNUALLY AND THE Committee on Trusteeship CHAIR FOLLOWS UP ON COMPLIANCE. NON-COMPLIANCE IS BROUGHT TO THE ATTENTION OF THE BOARD PRESIDENT FOR FURTHER FOLLOW-UP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE, CONSISTING OF BOARD OF TRUSTEE MEMBERS, REVIEWS THE PERFORMANCE OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND COMPARES COMPENSATION TO ITS PEERS BASED ON SURVEYS PERFORMED BY SCHOOL ASSOCIATIONS and an independent compensation consultant. THE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE KEY DATA AND PROVIDES A RECOMMENDATION TO THE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. For key employees, the head of school determines compensation based on an annual performance review and periodically compares compensation to that of their peers based on surveys performed by school associations.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICTS OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE PROVIDED SUBJECT TO WRITTEN REQUEST AND UPON APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OR THEIR APPOINTED DESIGNEE.
THE ORGANIZATION HAS NOT CHANGED ITS OVERSIGHT OR SELECTION PROCESS DURING THE TAX YEAR.
THE ONLY NONSECTARIAN GIRLS' DAY SCHOOL IN NJ, KENT PLACE SCHOOL PROVIDES A RIGOROUS AND FULFILLING EDUCATION FOR 600+ STUDENTS IN KINDERGARTEN THROUGH GRADE 12 WITH A COED PRESCHOOL.
